Without having to use long, drawn out paragraphs to describe the dark depths of silo life, Mr. Howey puts the reader in the silo...I could easily imagine the steel steps, hear the clanking of boots against the stairs, and see the round walls of the stairwell.  I have never read anything like this and loved the presentation of the Omnibus.  The reader gets a glimpse of silo life in the first book, but learns more with each book, always something new about this post-apocolyptic world.  I couldn't stop reading this, and would have to make myself put the darn thing down at 3 am.  Hugh Howey's follow-ups, First Shift and Second Shift, offer more of the same exciting writing.  Looking forward to more from this talented writer!!

From what I understand, the first "chapter" of this book is actually the short story that inspired the writer to expand out into a full novel.  Well, it starts off great, and stays great through the whole edition. Highly recommended.

In my day job, I'm an editor of science fiction. I have no connection with this book, save that my husband read it and strongly, strongly recommended it to me. My pleasure-reading time is precious to me, and it's so rare for me to find a book that bypasses my editor-brain and lets me ignore a stray typo or two and devour it as a reader. I read WOOL 1 in a single sitting, and then I was hooked. The pacing is perfect, allowing the reader to build suspicions about the way the world works, without making the next twist predictable -- giving enough information for you to figure it out for yourself, but enough ambiguity to make you doubt your conclusions. Beautifully written, tense, and powerful from start to end.

I started reading the Wool series based-on a friend's recommendation and couldn't stop reading after the first book (short story).  The story is rich with characters and details- so much that I could visualize what every scene looked like.  I won't go into details of the story and spoil it for those who haven't read this yes, but if you haven't read this, I highly-highly-highly suggest that you do!
I had put off reading this as many of the lower priced Kindle books are pretty bad and I had never heard of the author. I was pleasantly suprised to find this book was a decent read. Nicely done!

I am not a big fan of anything sci-fi or futuristic, but this novel just blew me away!  Written with a great deal of passion, the storyline becomes very believable.  We are certainly not too far removed from this world created by Hugh Howey.  His style of writing was very absorbing and you felt part of the story.  I plan on reading the 6th and 7th installment as well, although I have heard there are different characters involved.  I enjoyed Wood immensely!!
Very realistic view of a possible future. Couldn't stop reading it. Immediately downloaded and read sequels. Can't wait for more!

Discovering that wool is used in cleaning outside the silo has got to be the greatest title ever. As for the price? I'll take five hundred pages for six bucks any day. Last but not least is the writing. This one is solid all the way through. My only knock is that the last two books began to feel tired and my interest waned. I scanned the last thirty pages to see how it would come out. Was the author tired at this point? The ending felt kind of bland and what about the children in the abandoned silo? It seemed more of a distraction than anything else. I also think that the reader is a little bit cheated with the manner of evil IT guy's ending. What, no showdown with the girl that he cast out? The scene was okay but not great. Not that I didn't enjoy the read. I couldn't put the first three books down. Yeah it's Sci-Fi but believable for the most part. That's what appeals to me the most.

Once I got into the groove of this book, I had a hard time putting it down (which was about page 10 haha). Loved the characters, they way it was written, the plot, everything. This is my first 500+ page non required reading I've finished.... Great choice. Great job, Hugh Howey.

Have you ever eaten something and after the first bite you are amazed by the excellence of your choice. Wool is like that experience. I read and read, savoring every twist and turn and upon completion sated, but anxious for more if it comes to fruition. Read Wool you will not regret a moment of it.

I am normally not into futuristic tales or science fiction, but this book pulled me in immediately and I loved every minute of it. I have also never read a series before without losing interest, but with this one, I read all the books in the series and can't wait for the next one to come out. A must read!!
Absolutely fantastic writing! The twists and turns are endless, the character development is brilliant. It's nearly impossible to put these books down, and at such a low price, how can you say no?

In the vein of matrix, this dystopian future tells the story of what happens when elitist humans are the machine. Yet, by the end, I was left wondering if characters like Bernard, evil and corrupt, were just doing what they knew to make the best of a situation they were thrown into without choice: the better to preserve the human race until the world could be rebuilt. Classic question of whether the ends justify the means. However, I could never agree with how it began in the first place. Too vague? Read it and find out for yourself if you agree. You won't want to put it down.

I very rarely write reviews at all, much less gush praise, but this amazing collection from a hitherto unknown author deserves some promotion. My understanding is that this was self-published, but you'd never guess it from the quality of the writing and storytelling. Very well-paced, excellent character development, and well-conceived (though dark) plot and setting.  Although fans of "hard" science fiction will love it, in my opinion the writing is so good that it should appeal to a broad audience - I'm reminded of Margaret Atwood in this regard.
I am an old school sci-fi fan and while this series wasn't perfect it enjoyed it with only a minimum amount of page skimming.
Excellent dystopian story, slightly reminiscent of Hunger Games but better written & less manipulative.  A very good read. Liked it

I am honestly not even sure how I found this book, but I am so incredibly glad I did! I can't top what other reviews have said, so I won't even try. If you have not read Wool, don't waste any more time - the omnibus edition is well worth the price. This is an amazing story!
The writing is good, and subject matter interesting.  The author is good at describing characters, although lacks subtlety.  I would recommend it.

Thanks, Hugh Howey for bringing me back to the world of science fiction. It has been a long time, and I wasn't sure whether or not I should lower my literary expectations. Turns out that wasn't necessary. I appreciated the gripping plot, developed characters, and insights on culture and human nature that extended well beyond the silos. Bravo!
I have been reading fantasy books for 15 years.  Elfs, orks, dragons and all the other races. I was searching for something new.  A breath of fresh air. Wool has rubbed me the right way I can breath

A gripping page turner. An inventive idea  about what it means to try and control a population with fear and lies. Eventually the truth comes out. There are always consequences when keeping secrets. A must read!

My husband asked that I only read the first book of the series (because he loved it so much) and left it up to me if I wanted to continue reading. The first night, I read the entire first book. I read the remainder in the next week! A very well written, engaging and thought provoking book. I highly recommend it!

I randomly stumbled across this series, but I couldn't put it down after starting.  The worst thing was, I  was very disappointed that the storyline had to come to an end.  I really hope Howey picks up where he left off!

I'd never heard of this book before, and picked it up for my Kindle based entirely on the recommendation of a friend...and what a book it is!  I have already spread the love, and recommended it myself to several friends.  'Wool' is destined to become a classic of the sci-fi genre...equal to the works of Asimov, Bradbury, Vonnegut, Herbert, and others.  Books like this are one of the reasons that I bought a Kindle...I wanted to have access to free/low-cost, self-published ebooks by unknown authors and Hugh Howey does not disappoint.

This is the first book review I have ever written and it is more of a plea than a review.  I finished Wool 1-5 as well as First Shift and Second Shift last week and I cannot stop thinking about the whole series. They may be the best books I have ever read--certainly they have had an effect on me and I cannot stop thinking about the third installment.  Hugh Howey is brilliant.  At first I wasn't sure that introducing so many characters in the first books would work--I mean--you get attached and then they are gone.  But, now I see how critical it is to the whole universe of Wool because the different perspectives and experiences of the characters just makes it all so much stronger and real.  Now that I have finished, I can't stop thinking about silos or nanotechnology and how seemingly intelligent (or not) ideas just go to hell and, in this case, contributed to the destruction of the world as we knew it.  Howey raises some great questions about the nature of humans, politics, power, rebellion...why do they clean? and so much more.  I love the idea that the entire series is going to come together and in the end I think we are going to see a final showdown between the people who created the world underground and those who have lived in that world for centuries.  The creators will have to full on face what they did and I am sure (especially Donald) is not ready for that. Who knows how this finale will play out, but I can barely wait to read it.  Thank you Hugh Howey for writing these books and planting a fantastic story into my brain that might be there forever.  Please hurry with Shift 3!

I found this complilation of the series fun to read with many points of suspense.  It kept me wanting to continue reading when my head should be hitting the pillow for sleep because I wanted to know what happened next.  I just started book 6 and will continue with this series.

I do not normaly write reviews but felt compeled to after reading "Wool-Omnibus edition". I am not a fast reader, uselly takes me 2-3 weeks to read a book I like. But I got to a point in this were I couldn't stop. I had to know what was going to happen next, then after that, and so on, till I ran out of book. :( Didn't finish untill 1:30am. I read the "Molly Fyde" series and really enjoyed those so I tried out "Wool" Loved it!!! Thank you Mr. Howey I look forward to reading more of your work.

The author makes beautiful use of the language in telling this story. It is truly sci-fi with a great plot that keeps  you guessing, without becoming overburdened with unnecessary details --and this is accomplished without any loss of intensity or  relevance to a real fan of intelligent, coherent sci-fi. Howey presents characters that are believable and made to come alive in ways worthy of a great novelist in classic literary fiction,such as Dickens (not a claim I would make lightly). It is a compelling, fun read. What more can one ask? I just wish there was more of it, as I was ready to see what the major players would do next. I treated myself to the enhanced version on Kindle Fire HD  and have found this to be the most enjoyable read I have found to date in this format. The story is so well told and the reader does a great job on the audible portion that whether I was just doing some straight reading, reading along with the audible portion or just listening--all were equally enjoyable and I never felt I was losing anything by going with whatever happened to be the most convenient  method for me to use at any given time. A winner all around!
Great read, very entertaining, and it really takes off in the last volume. The lead female character was great, and this would make the best movie ever!

I bought this book because it was one of the Amazon Daily Deals. I look at the daily deals that are rated with 4 stars, but automatically buy the 5 star ones (except for Romance or Horror). I generally like Mysteries the best, but read a few top sellers and Science Fiction or Fantasy when my kids recommend it. This is a book that surprised me. The writing was great, the story line was excellent, and the pace was good. I especially liked that a young female was such a strong character in the story. I highly recommend this book.

I enjoyed the book 'Wool 1-5 Omnibus'.  The author got my attention from the very first sentence.  My better half, (wife), attempted on several occasions in my marathon read one evening to get me to come to bed.  Needless to say I finaly finnished at 5 in the morning.  Couldn't put it down.  I look forward to Wool 6 and beyound.

Wow. Where to begin. Let me start by saying that this is the best book I've read in a long time. The story was amazing, keeping you turning the pages, not wanting to stop reading and not wanting the story to end because it's so good! There's not extra fluff, the prose isn't flowery - and yet it is written with much more beauty than most of the stuff I read. It has a way of giving you the story without extra padding or heavy description or exposition and yet makes you take a breath every once in a while to appreciate the refined poetic way Hugh Howey writes. This guy is a gifted storyteller AND a gifted writer. You don't see that often. It isn't easy to write in a way where the words don't get in the way of the story and the reader is able to just take it in and enjoy what's happening to the characters. If you get that in a book you know you're in good hands, but when they can do that and still sprinkle in amazing prose that has such a poetic beauty with wonderful images, similes, thoughtful ideas, well - you get Wool by Hugh Howey. Beyond all of that, the story world Hugh has built is so awesome! You just want to keep reading more about it. I'm so glad he's now writing the Shift books going back in time and telling us how the Silos came to be. I cannot wait to dig into the first prequel book First Shift! This guy is my hero. He has been cranking out these Wool books at an amazing pace and you'd think he spent years on them. They are just so well written and the stories are so well crafted. Now that I've read them for pleasure I think I'll have to do a slow reread, taking notes on why it is so good so I can learn from it as a writer how to do it right. Hugh Howey does it right in so many ways with Wool: Omnibus. Best book of 2012 hands down.

I read this book about 6 months ago,  and I can still remember everything because it was so good!  I couldn't put it down.  The idea of living in a completely contained silo is so interesting by itself, but the author held my interest throughout the book!  I highly recommend it, and I read a couple of books a week.
No negatives here. I downloaded the sample and was immediately immersed in an enthralling story line. I purchased the Omnibus Edition and couldn't stop reading.

Very rarely it seems do you discover a new author and series. My Kindle allowed me to do just that. Being my first review, I want to inspire any hesitant reader to fully enjoy the Wool series. Well conceived and exceptionally well written, the characters and story will stay with you for a long time after you turn your last page. Thanks to Mr. Howey for an outstanding couple of weeks of pleasurable reading.
Good sci fi story.  I did not want the book to end.  Look forward to further stories about the silos.

This story harkens back to the style of science fiction writing you might have seen in the 1940s-1960s.  This is not my usual genre (I am more partial to epic fantasy), but I found this story thoroughly enjoyable.  It took me until Book 2 to really get into it, but I found myself invested in the characters and in the story.  Overall, this story revolves around a clever concept that is generally well-executed.  There are also a number of twists which are not immediately obvious to the reader, which I found refreshing.  It's definitely a worthwhile read, and the price is tough to beat.
The Wool series is an absolutely amazing post-apocalyptic dystopian story, written in a clear, vivid, and educated style. Destined to be a classic.

I am not much of a reader, let alone science fiction. This book caught my eye because of the simple title and how many 5 star reviews. From the very beginning I was sucked into this world of the silo. I couldn't put the books down. I had to read. I read everywhere. I told people they need to read this book. This book will stay in my thoughts for a long time. I am very sad I am finished with it. I wish it would have more. I think this book should be on everyone's 'bucket list' of books to read. WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I would tell you I picked up this series 'cause I am an avid knitter and that would not be too far from the truth. This is not my typical genre, that being said I am hooked. Just finished Wool 6 and waiting for Wool 7, with the rest of the Hugh Howey fan club. To facilitate the wait - I am reading Hurricane by Mr. Howey. What great fun. Timely, contemporary and riveting.
Man, I feel lucky to have stumbled across these/this!!!  It just draws you in-- I hope there is more coming!!!  I don't want to be a spoiler so I'll just say-- start reading!

I am probably a little older than the usual Science Fiction reader but I have always loved it. I am 64 years old and female and this is probably one of the best science fiction books I have ever read. The thing I really loved is that there is no unnecessary crudeness. Sometimes I feel like books are being written by 6th graders that think they are being naughty but are really just being annoying.This story is completely satisfying and I cannot recommend it enough. Thank you Hugh Howey and now that I have found you I will be reading more.

After years and years of reading, it takes a lot to really captivate me.  Wool has me hooked.  Awesome writing, attention to detail and a wonderful story.  I can't wait to move on to number 6 and see what's next!  Wool is a classic!
I'm not really sure how I stumbled across this book, but I'm glad I did. The writing is excellent, the story is compelling and entertaining, and I was sorry when it was over.
These books were very well written. I had never heard of Hugh Howey before but I think he will be a huge success. Anyone with a taste for sci-fi will love it! Can't wait for more in this series.

I selected this book from the Kindle Daily Deals for $1.99 and was not disappointed.  Even though I am not normally a sci-fi reader, I found it very entertaining with an intriguing plot.  I would highly recommend to other readers.
From start to finish I enjoyed this omnibus.  I loved the main character and how she was developed. I hope the author keeps writing.

Only half way thru the entire collection since I started a couple of days ago. But obviuosly the stories continue to pull you into each one as you go. Part mystery, past sci fi, part philosophy, part anti-politic. I had not heard of this series until I bought it on Kindle and I'm glad I did. As a kindle special it is awesome. At regular price it would still be awesome.

I don't normally read science fiction books but the reviews on this series were so good I figured I would try something new.  I was pleasantly surprised at how well written each book was and how story came together.  This would be an excellent book to base a Sociology class on.  Great job!

There is no doubt this book has blown me away. Superb story, gripping and in depth characters, and a believable scenario puts it up on par with other great science fiction works. From start to finish I enjoyed this book throughly and finished all five parts in less than a week. Would recommend this book to anyone who enjoys reading science fiction.

I loved this book. The writing was excellent and the story enthralling. I found myself staying up much later than I intended because I wanted/had to continue reading. I highly recommend this book and I can't wait to read happens next in this very captivating series.  I will most definitely be buying and reading more books by Hugh Howey.
I love this story. I found it to be very interesting and a different take on the apocalypse take. Love love love the knitting references throughout!

This set of books could have gone on and on.  Literally, I wish they would have.  While realizing that the story had to end somewhere, I still wish there were one or two more books to let me know that all of the remaining characters lived happily ever after. What a buy at $1.99!

The reason I say surprising is because I have been disappointed lately by some of the "end of the world" novels that have been spun out haphazardly.  This one is really very well written.  The concept is very interesting and though it is a bit predictable, you really don't care.  Very nice character development and just plain fun to read.  I am very satisfied!

I read books from all genres, and a truly good sci-fi is such a great change from the glut of murder mysteries that dominate the bestseller lists.  The one has all the hallmarks of a great story: drama, mystery, compelling characters.  And there's even some murder thrown in for good measure.  I've not yet finished this "omnibus," but I am truly invested in the story and sneak away with my kindle as often as I can to sink into the world of the Silo.  Definitely recommended.

The first book is only the beginning, but you will find it rich in new ideas.  The people in the story come to life in a natural way that you don't even notice as it happens.  Howey did an excellent job of not getting in the way of the story.  Definitely a good read.
Can't put it down! I just finished "Casting Off" and the story has taken an unexpected turn. Can't wait to see how it turns out!
Very entertaining and well written, and you really don't see things coming, I think this would make an excellent movie or TV series!

With an enjoyable pace, this series of books starts at a trot and never slows down. The twists and turns woven throughout the story line keep readers engaged and excited.  Finally, each of the characters is developed wonderfully and seemlessly.  A fantastic dystopian romp.
Howey has created a very interesting plot structure but his prose is only so so.  I hope he keeps writing and becomes more of a master with character development and language.
I have been reading WOOL in my own beautiful isolation and regret leaving the world of your engaging characters to tend to my own life.  Looking forward to  meeting up with each silo one day.

I thoroughly enjoyed Wool 1-5. The characters were believable and very likable- except for the bad guy! I was constantly surprised by what happened next and was so engrossed by the story that I actually held my kindle in one hand and vacuumed with the other. You will not be disappointed with this story and will feel a sense of sadness when you finish because the story is over..... For now!

It is so easy to see this happening.  The characters develop well throughout the series.  Read number six to see how it all started!  Also nice to read something that I can comfortably recommend to teens. No gratuitous sex, but it still appeals to adults.  Looking forward to future installments!

Thought I'd give "Wool" a try since I heard some co-workers talking about it and it was so cheap.  All I can say is wow!!  I was blown away.  I won't give a synopsis since so many other readers already have (and I'm not an author), but I will say the depth of the charcters was amazing, the surroundings are described in vivid detail and the story telling is superb.  I'm now a fan for life!!
It's been quite a while since I read one this good.  Definitely exceeded my expectations.  It'd make a great movie.  Keep going, Hugh!

This is a very well written story that you won't easily forget. It's a very human story and I recommend it to those who don't normally consider themselves fans of ScienceFiction. I am anxious to read book 6 because even though this omnibus edition does have a satisfying ending, you still want to know more about what happens to this world. You won't regret getting this one and it was even better than most of the Kindle editions I've read in that there weren't too many editing mess-ups in this one. It flowed smoothly and I greatly enjoyed it!

I highly recommend this collection! You will be happy you have have the next book to go to, I was unable to wait to start the next book! The author is very talented, able to stir your heart strings as well as keeping you guessing! The series is the work of a true science fiction writer! Look for him to be the next Neil Stephenson! I've since gobbled up everything he has written and been pleased! Keep up the writing, and I'll keep up the reading! Great work!

As I was looking for a new book to read I came across this one. I purchased the omnibus series of five and started reading. This series has everything in it, I really could'nt put my Kindle down, I needed to see what was coming next and there was always something. Best I've read in a while and I just purchased book 6 and I'm already looking at this author's other books. Great read.

No one had to pull the wool over my eyes to see that this was truly a masterpiece of work! Hugh Howey has just become my favorite author. The characters, plot, pacing all are on target to make a gripping tale of survival and hope. I could not put this book down as read on my new kindle fire HD until my battery died.  The main character, Juliette, you can really identify with. There is a fan art of her I found on the author's website that really gives her beauty justice. Check it out: [...]. But anyways, really awesome book and I would highly recommend it!

I really enjoyed this and would definitely recommend reading it as one longish book - not sure the five individual stories would hang independently.  While completely different, "Wool" reminds me of Asimov's "The Foundation Trilogy".  It moves along nicely and has enough surprises to keep you guessing.  Criticism?  Just one, I think they could have come up with a better title.
I loved this book!  Wool stands on story, rather than lasers and aliens, as a great contribution to the genre.  I can't wait to read the next installment.

I was so inspired by this series (which I gobbled up in a couple of days) that I went to the Summit entertainment and Focus Features websites to recommend it.  Of course they dont "want" recommendations so I never sent them the email I had wanted to send (maybe part of the problem with the film industry).  Anyway I like to think of this series as a Logan's Run meets Dune.  I really felt a connection with the characters and was hungry for more after I read the last installment.  My wife is enjoying the Molly Fyde series and with the high that I am on I may just have to do that as well!  I think what makes the series enjoyable is that it is NOT predictable.  If I can predict what is going to happen next then I don't enjoy what I am reading.  These books keep you on your toes, has twists and turns but still gives you what you want in the end.  I think this would also make a really great movie, big budget not needed.  Highly recommended.
This is some of the best writing that I have read in awhile and I read a lot. Right up there with Orson Scott Card.

This was an amazing set of books set in a future world where people live in a silo run by the tech geeks.  It is always wonderful to find a new author who is able to create a world that pulls you in, and keeps you engaged throughout a story - this one did it! The story unwraps over 5 "books" and is difficult to really say much about without giving away spoilers so let me just say - I read it in 3 days and it is one of my favorites of the summer.  Get it, and read it - you'll love it!

I became a fan of science fiction when I read the "Dune" series  again and again.  I often despair of finding good science fiction that is not fantasy and is as engrossing as "Dune".  Wool has done it for me.  I have not read anything this good in a long time and can't wait for the next installment.  The story line and the emotional lives of the characters are engrossing.  While I can imagine how the silos came into existance there is still an air of mystery surrounding the culture that developed and how it will change -- or not -- depending on future events.  I think I will be reading "Wool" again and again.

These books are by far the best that i have read, ever. If you like the hunger games series you will definitely love these. Book 1 is good and they only continue improving to book 5 which is amazing. Looking forward to more.

Wool is one of those stories that sits with you long after you finish reading. I'm glad a I came late to the party and actually got to read this all in one sitting (practically) because I would have been going nuts waiting to find out what happened next. That's not to say I'm not looking forward to more, but the story does end really well, with enough closure to be satisfying, but enough intrigue to want to read more. Hugh Howey created such an amazing world with characters I immediately felt for, that I was hooked after just a few pages. This is right up there with my favorite books of the year. Thanks Hugh. And thanks for showing the world you don't have to be published by the big six publishers to create fabulous stories. Keep up the great work!
Scarily believable especially after reading book 6 which is the prequel. Looked forward every day to reading more. Wouldnt have put it down if it werent for that pesky job thing.

I'm not a big science fiction fan, but when my cousin recommended this book I thought I'd check it out.  I loved it and have just ordered the next book in the series "First Shift".  I can't add any more than what others have posted.  Just read it.  It's six bucks and you won't regret a penny.

I'm ashamed to admit it, but I nearly skipped Wool simply because I assumed it was a 100 pages or less since it was so cheap.  It's a great read with developed characters and plot twists that keep you page tapping.  Glad I stumbled upon him in Kindle.

Great story in a believable dystopia and a lot more to come from the looks of how it ended. Like Vernor Vinge but underground. Technology/science is a steampunkish but that's ok - it isn't the focus of the action. I look forward to reading more in the series.

Stop what you're reading and pick up this book. I couldn't put it down and have been recommending to friends. Once you've finished this, move on to First Shift, which is a perfectly satisfying prequel that doesn't fully deliver the same punch as this original Wool series.

This book was completely immersing from chapter 1. Putting down was incredibly difficult! A wonderful book! The author is very descriptive, and the pace usually riveting. I love his sense of tragic irony in these books. The characters are also very believable and realistic. I loved this book, and the title makes more and more sense as the story progresses.

WOOL is an absolutely amazing series.  I was drawn in immediately by WOOL 1, which I think has one of the best twists I've seen in quite a while.  It really set the tone for the rest of the series.  The other novellas are just as captivating, with great character and plot development throughout.  Highly recommended.

This is quite possibly one of the best books I have ever read. This series has a gravity that pulls you in and keeps you there. On several occasions my roommate nearly had to remove the Kindle from my lap by force to make me go outside. The attention Hugh gives to all his characters is a breath of fresh air to me. I hate books that immediately fall stagnant, whether it is because of bad dialogue, or that the author ceased caring for his story -- feeling bored, just wanted it to end... This book, on the other hand, intrigued me and had me craving more from the very first page to its last.

I just finished Wool (the Omnibus edition) which contains the first 5 installments in this story.  What a great read.  If you like science fiction infused with a great deal of humanity you will enjoy these books.  The world is painted well, and you won't be able to put it down.  I devoured it!  I am so happy to discover there is another installment, and could potentially be even more.  This book illustrates one of the best things about Amazon and this age of digital self publishing.  If your books are good, people can find them and read them and decide for themselves with no middle man publishing house deciding for you.

This is by far the best sci-fi series I have read in a long long time.  I usually find myself predicting what would happen in a series of books and finding myself not at all surprised when it happens but I will tell you that the Wool series kept me hooked the entire time, always wanting to read just one more chapter to find out what was going to happen.  The characters are engaging and you really feel like you understand the motivations and actions being taken.  Nothing was really too far "out there" to not be believable given the circumstances.  Totally engaging and I really hope someone at HBO or stars or somewhere is reading these reviews because this deserves to be made into a 1 season mini-series.  I think there is too much there to do it justice in a movie.
Stop reading all the "5 star reviews"  and start reading this book now! You won't be able to put this book down! It's simply awesome!  Buying Part 6 now and preparing for another "all nighter"!
Amazing to consider what humans could possibly do to mankind... the mind control and manipulation is certainly present in some cultures. Can't wait to read book 6!

Great series, great start.  This is a very rich world, filled with gritty, wet, greasy details.  The pacing is fast, there's never a dull moment and the structure really threw me for a loop; I had NO CLUE what was going to happen next.  The chapters end with cliff hangers that made it impossible to put the book down.  Looking forward to see how the powers that be will react to the new order in Silo 18.  I want more.  NOW!

Each edition of the Wool series adds an additional layer of complexity and information, providing insight into previous reading.  Howey does this quite well.  The additional information is socketed into the story without being overly redundant and repetitive.  Bravo!  The characters are well-developed individuals.  The reading level is adult and complex, but the content is appropriate for younger readers.  If you are a parent struggling to find material that is appropriate for a young advanced reader, then the Wool Omnibus edition fits the bill.  In my opinion, both the reading level and content (not the plot) are comparable to the Hunger Games or Ender's Game.  And again, Bravo!

This series started off a bit slow, but once it picked up it took off! What a fantastic and fascinating story! I can't wait for what comes next. The author refers to himself as a nobody, but he is sure to be a superstar soon! Best $5.99 I've ever spent!
This was a well written story and definitely worth reading. I would recommend this for anyone who likes post-apocalyptic fiction.
Gets you and keeps you, untill it releases you after a mind numbing experience that will leave you craving for more.

I'm a huge sci-fi fan and I've read many hundreds of sci-fi books over the past 25 years.  This book was a fantastic find!  The story was very original and compelling.  The writing was tight. The character development was great-I really cared about what would happen to Jules and I found myself cringing every time I thought Howley was going to "off" her.  At several points along the way I thought I had the "mystery" figured out but I was continually surprised.  Great book, I really think this will be a classic someday and I HIGHLY recommend this.  It would also be a great read for non-sci-fi fans because the story is so solid but not bogged down by complex science or technology which some people (my wife) can find distracting. I've never reviewed a Kindle book before but I thought this was so good that the author simply deserves the positive feedback.
Found myself staying up till the wee hours reading.  The only downside to "Wool - Omnibus" was the loss of sleep.
Hugh Howey is a gifted storyteller. Read his stuff now so you can say you were into him before he became hugely famous.
Just finished Wool 1-5 and you have me hooked  I will have to get the rest to see how it ends, if it ends.

Great storytelling, and very enjoyable to read. Loved how many deep characters there were, and how the author doesn't shy away from killing them off or introducing new ones even after the first few books. Probably one of the best sci-fi books/series i have read in a long time.

Wool is one of the best "lottery"type series I have read. I had just finished The Hunger Games and was very diappointed in the quality of the writing. Then I saw "wool" and was curious.From the very beginning I couldn't put it down. The writing is tight,concise and crisp. I consider this author an exciting find,I will definitely be reading anything he has to offer. I pass his name on to anyone I can. This is an author I can talk to my grandchildren about. An author at the beginning of a book makes you a promise of what he is going to tell you,this man does it and more. This was an exciting experience.

I bought Wool Omnibus edition based on reviews which is something that I do not do very often.  The sheer number of positive reviews (and ratio of positive to negative) convinced me to buy the series rather than try the first book for free.  I LOVED these books.  I cannot put it any other way. Honestly I think that if I wrote this review without holding back than nobody would believe it was from a satisfied customer and just think it was the author trying to bid up his work.  These books are that good.  To all potential readers: buy these, you will not be disappointed. To the author Hugh Howey: Thank  you, this is a fantastic story and very well written.  Please continue with this series, First shift is fantastic too, great work all around.  I will keep an eye out for your next release.

I bought and read this book on Kindle because of the rave reviews.  Rarely does one find so many 5 star reviews for any book!  Now that I've read it, I can see why.  The book is very well written with great plots, unexpected twists and wonderful character development.  I had a hard time putting this book down until it was finished. Now I can't wait to read more of his work.  I was planning to review each of the 5 books in this volume, but they flow so well together that it seemed more like long chapters in one incredibly good book.  Sci-fi at its best. Buy and read this book, you won't regret it!!!!

I never write book reviews, but this series is so good I felt the need to shout praises from the rooftop!  Don't let the low price fool you - this is fantastic writing that will draw you in from page one.  Superb.

Happened upon this series while browsing inexpensive Kindle books. From the very first chapter I was stuck like chuck. Completely and utterly obsessed!  I couldn't pull myself away and read it in two days. When I finished Omnibus I went online searching for more and was relieved to find book 6 (I'll review my thoughts on that one separately). Read that straight through in only a few hours. Can't believe I rushed such a good thing! Searched Hugh's webpage looking for book 7 and ugh....only in the beginning stages! I'm squirming in my seat with anticipation. It's been forever since I was so immersed in a series!
I picked it up based on the reviews and they were right. Excellent characters and an enthralling story. Highly recommended...

This book was a wonderful find and not at all as I was expecting. I am partial to post  apocalyptic literature, and I am always searching for the next great one. This one goes in the short list of books to recommend. Engaging characters, believable scenarios, and a great tale of how it would be if we were starting all over again with technology but only hidden knowledge. Read it.

Loved it, twists and turns made it exciting. Characters were well developed and the descriptions made me feel like I was right there in the silo alongside the action.  I couldn't put it down, had to keep reading to the end.
Absolutely loved this book!  Looking forward to reading the next one and the next one.. etc.  A must read for Sci-Fi book lovers.

This story is a breath of fresh air in a market full of indie drivel. I agree with the reviewer who said it is destined to become a sci-fi classic. This is a great book, I'm recommending it to all my friends, and am especially grateful to the friend who recommended it to me! I have had a hard time finding something good to read lately, and was very pleased when my friend recommended this book. I read the sample on Amazon, and was immediately pulled in. The writing style is engaging, and the subject matter compelling. I can't give 5 stars, I reserve those for books of Dune quality. I definitely believe the set of 5 should bring in more than $6.00. I would have paid $10 and am going to Mr. Howy's website to donate the other $4. Thanks for a fun read!

Wool is a tremendous addition to the dystopian genre. From the moment I started reading, I was completely engrossed. The world of the Silo felt so *real*, I could practically hear the steps resonating on the metal staircase. The book scales very well, by which I mean that the ideas are broad in scope, but the interactions between the characters feel very real. You can't sell big ideas without having believable, interesting, and flawed characters, which this book has in spades. I can't recommend this book enough. Well done, Mr. Howey!

I bought this box set of 5 books as a "back-up" book, you know in case I finished a book and couldn't download a new one right away. The first couple of books in the box set left me a little depressed with the endings... then I get to the 4th book and was so hooked I couldn't stop flipping pages to see what would happen. I was so sad to start the 5th book not knowing that there was a 6th book. I had to go and buy the 6th before I could finish the 5th one. I hope that there are many more to come in this series! I want to know what happens in Silo 17 with Solo and the kids. I want to know if the "virus" spreads to the other silos. I want to read them NOW!

This is an excellent series that I found by accident.  If you are into apocalypse scenarios this is a book for you!  I've never written a review before and felt is was necessary for these books.  The character development is excellent.  The silo is cool and scary real all at the same time.  Pick this up, you won't regret it.

I read many reviews before I read this book. I was very skeptical about all the great reviews because I never heard about this author. Once I starting reading it, I was hooked. I loved all the characters and the author just did a great job describing the environment and the emotions that went along with living in a silo for years. Each book within this book had great endings, I thought to my self at the end of each book, what is the author going to do now with the next book. But Hugh Howey kept writing and creating exciting material and just delivered a really good book overall. I can't wait to read the 6th book in the series, it's a prequel. I highly recommend this book. Enjoy
Wow, what a creative and interesting read? Always amazed that a person can actually come with such an interesting story. Cannot wait for the next book!

If you are concerned about this being a self-published book -- no worries.  The writing is equal to much of what I have read by well-established authors.  One of the joys of reading this book was knowing almost nothing about it.  I had no advance knowledge of the setting which I feel really enhanced the experience of being led into the world by the author.  That's why I say -- stop reading the reviews and just go ahead and get the book already!  I'm referring to the Omnibus edition (you will want it all).

I read this series after trying the free sample, and was quite taken in with the story.  I am often reluctant to try new authors, preferring to stick with my tried and true favorites -- but I have a new one now.  I like believable human stories, and technology, and both were available in quantity.  The struggle between good and evil always adds interest, too.  I just obtained the next installment in the series, and have started reading it immediately.  I expect great things from this author in the future.

The author creates a vivid post-apocalyptic world.  I don't want to give anything away, but I really enjoyed the unique world that the author created, as well as the engaging characters.  This should be a classic of science fiction. Hopefully the self-publishing won't doom this work to obscurity.

I have to admit, I wasn't sure about Wool at first. The customer reviews finally sold me on it and the first book of the series had me hooked! I instantly became part of the Silo, a citizen who became excited, scared, angry (really angry sometimes) and happy right along with the characters in the books. The way he writes of the people, you are right there with them, side by side in the good times and the bad....(and the carpet gets ripped out from under you a time or two). Many times I would respond out loud, "I knew it" or "Are you kidding me?" I highly recommend these books!!!

I was searching for the next book to pass my time.  Didn't expect to find a book that made my time irrelivent. Each "book" flys by and leaves you wanting to continue. Great premise. Fantastic tone and mood.  I have 5 people I read with now flipping through the omnibus.

[No Spoilers] I've been reading Sci-Fi Novels for 25+ years. I've experienced the works of most of the well-known Sci-Fi Masters -- both old (50s) and new (90s, and onward). Everything about this series of books was a work of genius. First, the story. It had all the elements of great story telling. Surprises, twists, characters you'd care about, adventure, and so on. Second, fictional structure. Every "book" starts the story (or continues the story, where it left off), in a slightly different way. The author used structural variety in fun and creative ways. Third, subject matter. The messages. There are plenty. The story makes you think - about people who lead, justive, law, society, future, war, etc. I haven't enjoyed a book so much in a long time. Thanks Hugh, for your wonderful stories....

I was totally taken by surprise when I began reading this series of books. I was originally surfing for light reading but then I decided to refine my search and pick the "highest rated" books. When "Wool" came up at at 4.9, I thought, "how could so many people be wrong about this author? I have to take a chance". I am glad I did. This was the first book I ever took to work and read on my lunch break. I couldn't put it down. I started telling my family the storyline at first and then they started coming to me asking "what was happening." I think I have a new favorite author. The price for Wool Omnibus Edition almost makes me think I am stealing from you Hugh **laughs**, so I will go purchase "First Shift - Legacy (Part 6 of the Silo Series)" and give you a little more income.

This is a very captivating story, interesting and well developed characters. The author reveals the details of the circumstances and scenario piece by piece at just the right time. What others have said was true, I can't put this book down. I began reading the first page at around 11pm, my usual night time reading session which usually lasts an hour or two. But I stopped reading at 5am, and only because of pure exhaustion. Very good read. Definitely worth way more than the listed price.
Book two may get a little slow, but the rest of the books are outstanding.  I can't wait for sequels (or prequels).

I am an avid hard sci-fi reader. I have been enjoying a lot more sci-fi as of late on my Kindle and came across this gem of a series. I enjoy stories exploring future history and the implications of our use of technology run amok. We live in a time where it seems more and more control is being asserted by fewer and fewer. This story explores the worst possible realization of a few who think they know best. The story reminded me of Dune in many ways, my favorite series of all time. I simply couldn't stop reading and sadly finished reading the collected stories in a day. I want more, so much more and Mr. Howey, I would gladly pay a premium to continue enjoying your fine writing. The story explores man rising to his best in the midst of the worst. The main characters are characterized well. The writing is fluid and well done. The themes are thought provoking and terrifying. What's not to love?! There is so much potential for this series, I can't wait to read the prequel I just bought. Keep it coming Mr. Howey. I hope Fox does better with the movie than Universal did with Waterworld. Your self published success has inspired me to finally write my own sci-fi stories I have been thinking about for long while.

Like other reviewers have also indicated, I found this novel nearly impossible to put down.  When I wasn't reading it (because I do need to earn a living) I found myself distractedly thinking about the characters like they were alive and living out their crazy lives while I was working.  I would have expected to pay a lot more for this book after having read it.  My only disappointment was that it ended too soon....a cleverly crafted plan Mr. Howey.  You will have plenty of followers willing to pay much more for the sequels, and the prequels!

First, I would like to say that I am not a huge science fiction reader. I have read some dystopian fiction that I have liked but not loved. Having said that I loved the wool series. I read none stop over a 48 hr. period of time getting maybe 5 hrs of sleep total in that 48 hrs. I just could not put it down. Each book got better and better. The plot was incredibly original but, at the same time you could see how this world that these people live in could come to be. Wool kept you on the edge of your seat wondering with each plot twist what was going to happen next. In no way was this series predictable. Hugh's description of this world on the inside and out was so detailed it was like you were there. I had no problem picturing everything clearly as the story went along. All the above alone would make this a great book but, where Hugh's real talent lies is with his incredible character development. His description of a character is so detailed you feel like you really know this person. You become invested in there lives, relationships, families and jobs. You come to care for them and you need to know what happens next. As the book goes on all of these characters lives become intertwined with each other. There is suspence, intrigue and conspiracy. This book makes you think, even when you finish, you will keep these characters with you for a while. I can not wait to read any thing else Mr. Howey has wrote.

A thoughtful, well-plotted SF masterpiece.  Howey has created an alt-future dystopia where humanity is reduced to living in ~50 self-contained underground bunkers, each unaware of the existence of the others.  Well worth reading, and I can't wait until the next installment.

This book is so good, I stayed up until 4:00 a.m. reading it.  It's not what I think of as an apocalyptic novel.  Additionally, the characters are not black and white.  Whether or not you like a character, you will enjoy slowly coming to understand each individual and the reasons for his or her actions and inactions.  Currently, you can read the entire first story, Wool 1, for free by clicking on "Look inside" the book.

The reviews for this series were so great that I bought the Omnibus first instead of buying the first book in the series and then making a decision on if I wanted to continue.  I'm glad I bought the whole set together.  It was extremely well written, it is a page turner, it's too young to be a classic now, but in a few years I'm pretty sure most Sci-Fi fans will have at least heard of it, if not read it themselves.  I love how each part of the series explores a different person's viewpoint.  I also loved the quick Q & A with the author at the end.  It personalized him for me, it made me feel happy, and I look forward to reading more of his work.  And I'd also be willing to pay a higher price for it, since I feel like this was such a bargain for what I got.  THANK YOU.

It's crazy how good this series is.  Completely consumed by the need to know what happens next, and thinking about the story whenever I wasn't actively reading it, I found Wool compelling and fascinating.  The writing is so descriptive and evocative that I felt as though I could *see* what was happening as I read about it.  Which of course made me realize what a terrific series of movies it would be!  As soon as I finished the Omnibus and book 6, I wanted to start the series over.  In fact, I've got a little time before bed...

I've been having a really hard time finding good Science Fiction books lately. Either they are too simplistic, written poorly, or written so high-brow as to not be enjoyable. Wool was just right. A genuinely original book (as far as I can tell) that actually left me surprised time and time again. I can't wait for Hugh's next novel. You should also check out his website - it's a trip. Like a Scalzi Jr.

I'm a huge fan of the science fiction genre and just happened to stumble upon Wool while searching in the Kindle store for a good read.  I couldn't seem to put it down, reading late into the night until my eyes refused to stay open.  Do not hestitate to purchase this because you will not be disappointed!

I bought this on a whim and boy am i glad i did!  To call these books is a bit of a stretch though, more like a bunch of short stories put together as a book is a lot more accurate description.  I'm glad i bought all of the "books" together though because to be honest, if i had bought them seperately, i don't think i would of finished the series. The first two books were a bit slow for me but once i got into the thrid book i totally understood why he did what he did with the first two books.  Great series, and very addictive to read.  I just had to keep on reading to see how it ended! Keep the series coming please!

I was definitely drawn into this book and couldn't put it down!  It was a great story, very well written.  I was so into the story and what was happening I tended to skip some of the detailed paragraphs.  It is amazingly written, and the characters are so real.  I have no complaints to this book whatsoever and I hope that one day it is turned into a movie.

Wool was recommended on a list of Dystopian fiction that I came across. Several people said it was better than The Hunger Games, and after finishing Wool (the omnibus edition), I have to agree. It is a great story, fast paced, and one I couldn't put down.  I get a lot of books for free or at low prices for my Kindle, and was beginning to think they just weren't worth it. Readers can tell when a book has been self published and was poorly edited. Wool is the great exception. I would not have known it was self published. It is well written and error free. I am recommending this book to my friends and family and to friends of mine who have formed a Kindle "book club". And I recommend that you read it too. Grab it now while you can. The Omnibus Edition at only $5.99? It's a steal, and a great one at that!

WOW!  This was a fantastic read.  I could not put it down.  I don't usually read sci-fi or anything close to this "type" of book, but one day I was browsing through to find a good read, a different author, and came across Wool Omnibus (Wool 1-5).  The reviews were so good I decided to give it a try and I'm glad I did.  Looking for more Mr. Howey, keep them coming.  You are now one of my favorite authors and I can't wait to read more of your writings!!!  Do yourself a favor, buy the book, borrow the book, whatever, get it on your Kindle and settle down for a terrific read.

I adored WOOL, the first of Hugh Howey's dystopian sci fi adventures. I felt like a kid again as I gobbled down the story. It brought back the rush of first discovering Asimov, Clarke, Dick, Dahl, Bradbury, and my personal favorite Theodore Sturgeon. I plan on diving into the series and not coming up for air until I've ingested every tasty morsel.

I had huge doubts when I was ordering. I had even ordered a back-up book because I thought this just wouldn't be my kind of series. Started reading and absolutely loved it. I suggest reading it at the same time as someone you know because it inspires discussion and debate. Note to the author: the FAQ you included at the end inspired me to actually write a review, and I am about Togo purchase something else by you because I really enjoyed your sense of humor. Well done!

I purchased this with my Kindle app on my ipad because of the great reviews. I'm so glad I did. I love to find new authors. I'm a sucker for "end of the world" stories and I love this take. The character development was very well done. I love the way the entire concept was introduced - I felt like I was trapped in a silo of sorts, craving a glimpse of the bigger picture. It kept me turning the pages. I also enjoyed the treatment of group psychology, the perpetuation of traditions and the struggle for individuals to break free of groupthink and blaze their own path. I also enjoyed the moment of understanding when I realized why Hugh titled it "Wool." Now, I'm going to grab some more books from Hugh.

So very tired.! The "Wool omnibus" was a recurring recommendation but my very  jaded view of modern SF did not believe the reviews. They are all right. Vivid descriptions, breath taking cliff hangers, great characters, real relationships, compassion, understanding and vision.  I read until the early hours of the morning and haven't done that for years. Oh yes and an ending that  could lead to more but is so satisfying.

I bought the Wool stories individually rather than the Omnibus and loved each one.  This is a great series and worth much more than the price of admission.  I'm so glad there are more Silo stories coming after this one.  This is great science fiction and great writing.

I really enjoyed this series.  It started out with a freebie.  I had to have more.  They kept me captivated until the end.  For those that are bothered by cursing, there is virtually none until around the end of the third if I remember correctly and a few in the fourth and fifth.  It can be hard to get some good sci-fi books without many curse words.  Get this one, you won't be sorry!

After reading the trilogy of the Hunger Games I thought I would never again read anything of that caliber and I haven't, up until Wool!  I borrowed it based on all the positive reviews and with much skepticism waiting for yet another disappointment since Hunger Games.  Well what a pleasant surprise and wow was I ever wrong.  The book was well written and a real page turner with lots of surprises you don't see coming.  There are a lot of bad reads out there but that doesn't apply here.  I will anxiously await Wool #6 and beyond and will also be looking forward to a movie (I hope).

It's a great read, hard to put down and full of thought provoking ideas and well developed characters.  The story starts with an obvious short story, and each successive piece in the omnibus builds on this bit by bit.  There are some great transitions from character to character as the timeline progresses, and the world is very well thought out.  Every aspect is believable, and well constructed but delivered a piece at a time so you explore the world  as you read the story.

Great story, couldn't put it down.  Hugh Howey knows what he is doing with his story of mankind's effort to survive in a post apocalyptic world.  I cannot wait to find out what is happening in the other silos and perhaps what happened to those that have received the nasty red "X".

Do you even need to read this review? Just look at the number of 5 stars this book has gotten... and then buy it immediately. The plotting was excellent, the characters were full and captivating, and the story ran deep. This book now holds a well-deserved position in my top 20 favorites of all time.
I finished this series 3 days ago and it's still resonating with me. A great adventure, well told, great characters and I highly recommend it.  Very good book.

What a find...it out of the park brilliant, well written, and it's an indie work which competes with the publishing houses in every way except price.  I could not put it down even reading it from just under the table on my kindle tonight.  Mr. Howey is clearly on my favorite authors list from this point on.  I was totally into this world, it's issues, and the characters. Wool is on my top five for the overall best books I have read this year.
Finally, I've found a series that dethroned the Ender Saga as my favorite series. Wool is spectacular. Be warned, once you read the Omnibus, you will immediately buy all of Hugh Howey's other books.

Excellent writing and story line development... really tickled to see that the next gen of sic fi writers is so blessed with talent.. I was afraid the best of the best wrote in the 40s to 60s but this author shows there is  another golden age of sci fi ahead!  Looking forward to reading every book he writes!

This was one of the best books I have ever read. If you like dystopian novels with a lot of action and psychology, this book is for you. Way better than the hunger games and made for adults. Check it out.
Couldn't put this down from start to finish - I am eagerly waiting new installments and will be sure to share this with anyone that likes a good scifi read.

This was a take-a-chance buy and did it ever pay off. What I expected was a thin, slightly sour effort, what I got was a most pleasant repast. My only disappointment came at the end, I wanted more! The author does a beautiful job of dropping red shoes, leaving the reader eager to know more about this post-apocalyptic world and the people who haunt it's last bastions. I will be seeking more of the author's worlds, but I hope to revisit this one someday as well.

I found out about this series from the Boing Boing review and wow - this is one of the best series I've read in years. There is nothing more satisfying than finding an author that just has a style and skill that you don't want to put the book down and then once you've finished, you go right to everything else he or she's written and buy them everything you can.  This is just that kind of book.  I can't wait for more Silo series and until then I'm working my way through all of his other books.  Thanks!!

I read this book (these books?) over a month ago and the story is still with me. It is *brilliant*! I'm eagerly waiting for Wool 6 and I'm doing my best to convince everyone I know to read this amazing story.

I have not been this excited for a book series in a long time!  I could not seem to put it down.  I have "made" friends read it when they have been to my home.  I daydream about it and what the characters maybe doing now!  Hope there will be more...soon!

I typically have problems finishing books. I start one and never finish it. This wasn't the case with this book though, after I finished the first book in this edition, I didn't want to carry on. Then I just forced myself to start the second book and didn't want to put it down afterwards. The book continually gripped me by the balls and forced me to read. I actually lost a hour of sleep a few days ago due to a cliff hanger. I finished the book in less than a week and am glad I did. The end of the book left on a semi-cliff hanger though and can't wait till the 6th book is published. Not anything all that important but that one detail would be nice to know. Well I will be buying the 6th book as soon as it comes out.

This is by far the best series I have ever read. Never in my life have I slowed my pace for reading simply because I do not want to finish the book. I don't want the story to come to an end. I just can't get enough of the plot, the characters and wonderful words sewn together to construct an amazing story. I even Facebook'd the author! I am just so intrigued by the book that I will read anything that this author has to say.
Stumbled upon this series and ended up reading it as fast as possible it was so good. Looking forward to more from this series. Just buy it.
This book opens your eyes to the intricacies of the human mind, taking you on a powerful emotional journey. I'm super excited to read more!

Hugh Howey's Wool is an engaging look at a bleak future.  Survivors endure in a confined environment where behavior is orchestrated according to a playbook left by those who destroyed the world.  The main characters emerge from the backdrop of a mostly clueless society with an increasing desperation to escape a past that repeats itself.  The plot develops at a steady pace with characters that draw you into the story.  Whether you immerse yourself for a long continuous read or extend the experience a chapter at a time, Wool will capture your imagination and keep you wanting more.  I really enjoyed this book and look forward to a continuing adventure.
I thoroughly enjoyed this series.  Imaginative.  Captivating.  The more I read the more I wanted to read...to know.  You will not be sorry if you read Hugh Howey!!!

i read the first wool book a while back and loved it. i was browsing through the kindle store the other day and saw 'wool omnibus edition' and my immediate thought was 'what the duce?'.  after gathering my wits and whilst fighting the urge to wake my sleeping husband to notify him of my enormous good fortute, i prompltly pressed buy and immediatly set to reading.  i have never been one for labeling and dont know (or much care) for what genera this book falls into, all i can tell you is that this is a wonderful set of books and at $4.99 a jolly good buy. as a testament to how good this book is, i have for the first time ever written a review from my 3rd gen kindle...which is no small feat and also the reason there is minimal punctuation and no capital letters!

An absolutely engaging read! Two days in a row I nearly missed my subway stop, I was so engrossed in this story. After that, I was done, having blazed through these in no time at all. I can't wait for the next installment!

If you have not began to read this series at my previous recommendation, then you may not be the individual intellectual insidious reader I had previously & preciously recommend this series of hair standing, punch in the gut, & sometimes, nail biting, collection of short story formatted reads that most likely could be place in the league of an O'Henry. If my status or opinion offends or just "ruffles your feathers " a bit, I welcome anyone (after reading at least the 1st 2 books and no further!!) to enlighten me!!
This series is one of the best I have read in a long time. It is up their with the Foundation series and that says alot. Can't wait for the next edition.

There's not much more that I can say that others haven't, this is a great read and a total bargain for those that are sick of the current state of ebook pricing.  Get it.  I'm actually rating and writing the review for this in the hopes that Amazon's recommendation engine will notice and seed my recommendations with more books like it, and with more of Howey's work - its that good!  Very imaginative ideas, characters, and pacing.

Although I love dystopias, I hate that there are so few that are really good.  I'm used to stumbling upon half written, stilted ending and frustrating desperate attempts.  This is not one of those.  Oh, no.  This is well written, enthralling, and it will suck your soul in and hold it hostage until you finish it.  I gasped, I name called, I shook my fist, and I had to wash my mouth out with soap on several occasions.  You know it's a good book (or series of books) when you start blowing bubbles when you speak.  I am now a fan and will begin anxiously reading more from Mr. Howey.  I expect to see big things from him, and await these things with bubbled breath.

I bought the Omnibus edition on the recommendation of a friend. I was hooked! Read the first one, and since the others were right there on my Kindle, I just kept reading. I read them all in one sitting, had a rough time getting up the next morning. I highly recommend them

I purchased this book because of the favorable reviews on Amazon.  I am not disappointed.  For those of you who like stories about people and how they respond in difficult situations this book is for you.  The science fiction is only as a backdrop for a very good story about people.  Highly recommended.

I came upon this book(s)by chance and was pleasantly surprised to find myself unable to put it down. Another great dystopian fiction collection. I was a big 'Hunger Games' fan and this was just as enjoyable. Had to force myself to go to sleep instead of read. Hope the story continues.

First time reviewer and truly inspired to spread the greatness that I have just consumed in a few short days.  What an amazing read! Wool is sure to be a classic!  Hugh has created such a masterful dystopian world, and we have only just seen the tip of the silo. I recommend this to anyone and everyone, sci-fi fan or not.  You will be sucked in...and all 5 books in the Wool Omnibus for $4.99 is a steal.  Hugh also is an author that cares for the fans, keeps them updated and regularly posts on his website (hughhowey.com) and responds in his forums.  Be sure to check it out.  I am a new fan of Hugh's...only just starting Wool a few days ago, but I can say, without a doubt, he is my new favorite author from this reading alone.  I am anxious to see more about the Siloverse, but am glad I can come up for air, if only for just a short time. I just downloaded the remainder of his yarns onto the Kindle! I hear more great things a calling.

Scanning through available next reads Wool Omnibus popped up. What caught my attention initially were the large number of Five Star ratings and the complete absence of lower tier ratings.  I could not remember seeing a book with such overwhelming reviews. And now here I am happily adding my enthusiastic support as well. This was a fantastic read...first page to last.  And I so look forward to Wool 6 and beyond.

Wool (Omnibus Edition) has the best story I've read so far this year. Great pace, the sentences are just oozing with emotion. Wonderful, likable characters (except when we're not supposed to like a character of course, in which case the character seems despicable). The world painted by the author is vivid and thought out. Definite BUY and then lock yourself in a room and read in one sitting.

Every so often, one comes across an authour which totally flattens him. Happened to me several years ago with Neal Stephenson, and ever since, I've read everything he wrote. The same happened with Hugh Howey. Never heared of him, just browsing the store, read some reviews and tried it. What a pleasant surprise. Read the entire 500 pages during a 4 day vacation, couldn't let the book down. It's not just the subject, it's the way the book is written. I already downloaded a second book (Hurricane) and I'm half way through. I'm just as pleased with the second selection as I am with the first.

I really, really enjoyed this series.  I was almost heartbroken when I thought it ended at 4.  So glad I got closure!  Or should I say "bound off"?  I still wonder about the wool/knitting metaphor.  Very odd choice, but as a knitter and a science fiction fan, I found it an extraordinary pairing.  Well written with good character development and story line, with the kind of social examination one expects from classic sci-fi.  Highly recommend!

I absolutely support the indie aspect of this book and the accolades that the author has received. The story was hard to get into for me though. I don't mind "end of times" types stories (just finished "The Stand" which was ok) but ultimately this was just too bleak for me. I wish the author well and hope indie publishing continues to succeed.

Appreciated the story concept and was mildly entertained by the technical descriptions even though they went on too long.  Some of the characters came off to flat as persons in a closed world and some of the plots' unfoldings were labored and a bit shallow.  But the questions of character, survival, community, leadership were worth the read.

It has been refreshing to stumble upon a novel that is all consuming.  From start to finish, Hugh Howey's thoughtful storytelling paints a picture that is not only creatively distinct, but deeply moving.  A must read for those eager to experience fresh and engaging narrative.  WOOL secured me as a fan of Mr. Howey's entire body of work.

I bought this 100% based on the amazon reviews alone.  As soon as I finished the first book I sent a message to my good friends who I knew would love it that they NEED to pick this up.  They all did, and they all loved it.  All 5 in this series are great and I'm reading the first prequel now.  Thanks and keep em coming!

Not since "Ender's Game" almost 20 years ago have I read such an engrossing SF book! A believable world, populated by believable characters, living their lives in complete ignorance of their true destiny! Enough! You need to know nothing more, except to get this book, and prepare to do little else until you finish it!

I guess I should give it more time, but the first 20% of the story bored the hell out of me.  Climbing down 100 flights of stairs and then back up again?  It's gotta be me, but I just don't get it. I'm going to set it down and try again later.

I will remember reading this for the rest of my life.  Such an amazing saga of life and death and hope.  The characterization was off the charts good - so real they become a part of you and you fear for their futures, care about their past, and can't wait to see what happens on the next page.  Highly recommended.

Been a SciFi and Fantasy novel reader for 35 years and I loved this book. It's not often that I get nervous for characters when reading a novel but I did with this one.  Several times I had to put it down and go for a walk before I could read it again - I was starting to speed read to find out what happened next.

A fantastic concept and a well rounded world.  Wool is a fascinating read, a novel that really shows where post-apocalyptic stories can go.  However, I found the plotting a little tedious - specifically, it felt as if not much happened in great swathes of the book.  More action was needed.

Interesting idea that could have been a great adventure story/thriller and/or a fascinating psychological assessment of human behavior.  Unfortunately, it was neither.  As a thriller it was too drawn out.  As a psychological study, character development was too shallow, and there wasn't enough meaningful dialog about motives or analysis of the situation in which characters had to operate.

Hugh Howey is easily on of my favorite writers after this book. The characters, the setting, the overall plot are all amazing and kept me hooked through each book and left me wanting so much more! I can't believe it took me so long to find this Author, and I wish he had more books out.
I have lost all respect for a label that states: "New York Times Bestseller." This book was so mundane, that I could not wait to write this review. The "Times" have changed, not doubt.

I've just completed Wool Omnibus and I'm feeling sad that it is over.  What a great series.  I read so much that it takes a lot to really surprise me.  This did.  The story easily hooked me and kept me returning to my Kindle any time I had a spare moment.  It is so nice to read a well written, proof-read and edited book on Kindle that didn't cost an arm and a leg.  Thank you Hugh C. Howey for allowing this book series to be part of Amazon Prime Lending Library.  I look forward to more great works by this author.

I am halfway through the omnibus edition. I struggled for a minute to either give the series a 4 or 5 star, and decided on 5 to give Mr. Howey a benefit of the doubt. I probably have been reading a few too many novels lately and my brain cells haven't caught up yet. He reads all his reviews I've heard ;) I checked the reviews and was putting off purchasing until now based on a couple of reviews, I forgot their names but one woman from Texas said there seemed to be no hope. That is a bunch of drivel. Uprising is in the works.People in the story are fighting for the truth. Another fellow said there that Mr. Howey is too descriptive about objects. This too is drivel. Each author paints a picture and some use more brushstrokes.I didn't like Prip'yat from Mr Kraus as much as I liked Final Dawn.The first is more of a short the last a novel-series but the artistry is still there. I am new to post acopolyptic fiction and my favorite 3 are Howey, Kraus, and Molles. To me the greatest for a good story are believability and that the major characters don't shirk from their courage and become cowards, but expose the truth at all costs. I think there is an interest in this type of fiction because fiction many times parrallels reality. Most question now the truth in what the media says about 911 and how the bankers are spending more and more of our money but our economy gets weaker and weaker, and more of our freedoms are eroded. This questioning of authority and getting at the truth, not the propaganda is what seems parallel in this book of Mr. Howeys. For all you religious fanatics and those who are naive enough to think our government is there to protect us from the cradle to the grave. I too am christian, but read Romans 13 again and pay attention this time. The government is to be obeyed as it says. But the government described is a just government, one that upholds the good citizen and punishes the evildoer.When it does not there are exploits as it says in Revelation. And justly so. Mr Howey is a humble man. He even considers himself a nobody in his questions and answers on his website. I just ask him to not get caught up in his success and become proud, which I think will hurt his writing. I don't think he will but it should nevertheless be mentioned. Pride cometh before a fall. A continued success to you Mr Howey and well done!

Interesting but concepts have been seen and treated better before. I find it unrealistic that none of the silo masters have stopped following the Order before in 200 years and that humans in general would not question the many illogical aspects of life in the silo more.

I purchased this book because it was rated highly on multiple "best of" lists for both science fiction and speculative fiction.  I don't know why people constantly place speculative fiction books in the science fiction category.  This book isn't science fiction.  One could make an argument that it is speculative fiction, but I would argue against it, or at least it being on a best of list of speculative fiction.
