The environment has been destroyed and made toxic. For generations hundreds of people have lived in a giant silo buried deep in the earth and classified by trade: Mechanical occupies the "down deep" the lowest levels, more than 150 stories below the surface. Men and women who live and work there drill for oil and minerals and keep the physical plant going. Farming techs tend the hydroponic and soil plants and a few animals for food, and IT maintains the computerised communications system. IT also keeps the secrets including the origin of the silo. Crimes are few, but the penalty is "cleaning". Miscreants are suited up in specialized space suits and sent out to scrub the windows of the upper level of the silo. It is understood that no one returns from "cleaning". The protective suits produced by IT are only protective for a short time. After two deaths occur under mysterious circumstances a young woman from Mechanical begins to fear that all is not as she has been taught. Parallels can be drawn between the politics of the silo and today's politics, but not so many as to distract from an engrossing saga

The Silo Saga embraces classic dystopian themes that makes me think of Lord of the Flies; although a much more enjoyable read in my opinion. The first book in the series Wool pulls you in almost immediately as the characters are real, not fanciful, and the writing is excellent in that it is succinct allowing the story to unfold quickly yet retain a compelling mystery. The canvas for this story is quite limited, as you soon learn, but this allows the author to focus on the characters and dialog like a good play rather than be distracted by magic, fantasy or futuristic technologies - not that I have a problem with magic, fantasy or futuristic technologies. Wool is really a setup and leaves you constantly wondering why and how did this happen, the follow up Shift contains the answers and flips backward and forward in time seamlessly keeping me up late into the night. I'm still reading so I can't say much more but I've enjoyed it immensely so far. The only caveat is if you want something a little more light hearted then I doubt this is the book for you.

One picky point: Howey should consider consulting someone about technical matters that he's not familiar with. He seems to think (for example) that radios are tuned by varying resistance, as with a potentiometer. That's wrong, of course. Circuits are tuned by balancing capacitance and inductance. Howey might also have done some research on factors that impede radio signal propagation, and antenna theory. Still, this is a small matter. It's easy to suspend disbelief for storytelling this good.

Wool Omnibus (Wool 1-5), by Hugh Howey, is a tremendous science fiction novel about life in a post-apocalyptic world with an extremely toxic environment. The surface of the planet is totally unlivable, and the populous lives in a huge underground "silo," which houses thousands of people. I found the physical and social environment of the silo community to be fascinating. The structure begins at ground level and submerges about 100+ levels into the ground. People live their entire lives within the silo and never go outside. Life depends upon a highly technological society and is controlled by a highly developed IT compound situated in the mid-levels and a ruthless mayor who lives in the "up top" floors. All needed commodities, products, crops and other materials/items are produced within the silo. Different products and services are situated on specific levels and delivered where needed. The mechanical department, which handles life-support for the entire habitat, is located on the bottom levels (the "down deep"). The stairs are the only way to move from one level to another. Life in the silo includes rigid rules that must be followed, and breaking those rules incurs severe punishment from villainous leaders. Even speaking about certain topics or dissatisfactions can mean death by expulsion from the silo. Aside from its interesting environment and society, this book has many complex, colorful, eclectic, and endearing characters that endure excruciating situations and demonstrate heroic actions for the reader to appreciate. However, the reader must also endure breathless trepidation while characters are struggling for survival and gut punches from the death of characters. Wool is a totally engrossing story, which captures the reader until the end. In addition, Mr. Howey's prose makes it an even greater pleasure to experience this story. I recommend this novel to anyone who likes science fiction, and especially post-apocalyptic science fiction. I thought it was great and I plan to read his future installments.

This book kept me entertained the whole way through. Lets hope this isn't a glimpse of what could happen in the future.

I am a big science fiction reader and I loved this book.it was a good story with good characters. It has a different look at post apocalyptic earth that I really found interesting. I read it in a couple of days which usually only happens when I really enjoy a book. So anyone that likes Scifi  really should read this book.

Good read, but it's a very slow read with little to no action so it's easy to get bored reading this book, and to give up trying to finish it. I enjoyed the ending, but I did almost give up finishing this book a total of at least three times.
fabulous writing. couldn't stop reading! now I'm going to read more of his books and expect to enjoy them just as much!
I really enjoyed this book and am still reading the other books in the series. It grabbed my attention right away and held it all the way through.
Interesting book. It's different and thought provoking. Some areas a bit too far for me to believe, but it is science fiction after all.

I downloaded the free first chapter and by the end of it, I was hooked. Bought the omnibus and enjoyed every word.  Very disappointed when it ended. Looking forward to continuing to read from the Silo Series.
But then it falls off.  I would've like to see the same intensity throughout the book.  It became a pretty slow read around the middle.

I'm moving through book three now and I agree with all the reviews that encouraged me to purchase the omnibus rather than each book on its own. I love how Howey spends time with each character so we can see the multiple worlds of each as the story unravels. Great mystery throughout- can't wait to see what's going on. Reading this during my breaks at work, then on the way home one day heard Howey on NPR. Glad to see he's got the digital rights- there's a good story in this book's existence as well. Enjoy!

This is a great read. The story line has potential for many more books (50 at least ;).  The authors writing style made the pages flow like water and I was done with all 5 volumes and wanting more all to soon.  I would recommend this to any SF fan or fans of a Dystopian future.

More than science fiction, what makes this a 5-star is the story line that allows characters to shine through... Memorable and likeable characters, who are motivated by passion and purpose (kinda like truth, justice, and the American way type of thing). Sad for the end of a saga that could have held my interest for another 500 pages!
This has been one of the best books I have read in a while. I just couldn't put it down.
I love dystopian future fiction and read as much as I can get my hands on. This series was incredibly original and the characters are very well developed. I'd definitely recommend this series

Why didn't I give this 5 stars? Maybe I'm feeling a little particular today.  I don't have much criticism... Just that the author chose pace over character development in these books, maybe. I liked what he did so much, I just wanted more.  I found myself slogging through some of the violent parts of this.  Not my cup of tea... But overall, loved the concept, story and characters!
This book is full of twists and surprises. Again and again events seem to be at their worst, with no hope of redemption.  Five stars if the language were cleaned up.

I only give five star reviews for books which are life-changing, and this one is. It has everything - an original and perfectly constructed concept, fully fleshed out characters (even the minor ones) and a shock-a-minute plot. Plus it is masterfully written. Amazing. And as the cherry on the top, the author seems like a really nice guy.
THIS BOOK IS FUN READ.  THE PLOT IS ENGROSSING.  HUGH HOWEY'S EXCELLENT WRITING ALLOWS THE READER TO EASILY ENVISION THE CHARACTERS' LIVES WITHIN A SILO SURROUNDED BY A DEVASTATED WORLD.
I liked this book, because it is a one of a kind science fiction book. It had twist and turns around every corner.

Howey gives you a stimulating and interesting look at how people could justify truly horrible actions.  Indeed, how they could even feel compelled to continue such acts.  What starts out as a fascinating sci/fi story takes you to explore an ethical dilemma, and even be sympathetic to the "bad guys".  Heroine Juliette's musings near the end, coming to sympathize and even identify, with her adversary compells the reader to consider questions that none of us couldimagine ourselves making.

I wasn't sure what to expect coming into this book, but I was very pleasantly surprised. The characters were well developed, the plot was excellent and the pacing was right on. What made the book even better was Hugh's writing style. His turn-of-phrase. I found it often eloquent and frequently had to share passages with others.

Unique story that keeps getting better chapter by chapter.  This author won me over!  After reading the first chapter, I had to purchase all the remaining chapters.  I recommended this to friends and co-workers who all loved it.

As surreal as the circumstances the people in the stories find themselves, the realer their questions, actions, and reactions seem. And the story culminates with a true tale of moral heroism. Well done!
If I was asked, "What book should I read this year, and I plan on only reading one, what should it be?" I say, The Wool Omnibus Edition.
.. and I was not disappointed. I found it hard to put the book down. The silo idea seemed novel, I wish I learned more about what happened "outside", but the book was great. Maybe the sequel....?

My son recommended the omnibus edition of the Silo Saga to me. I found this to be a sci-fi with a twist. I enjoyed the characters and story line and look forward to what comes next. Juliette has the heart, brain, and brawn of a true leader. Can the Order be changed?  I hope so.
Mr. Howdy writes with stunning and vivid detail.  I couldn't stop reading the omnibus until I finished.  I look forward to reading the rest of the series.
If you're tired of reading books where you can figure out the entire plot less than 10 pages this is the book to fix that. Well written and entertaining throughout.

I recommend this book to anyone looking for a fun sci-fi fantasy book.  Might especially jump out to those who have played the fallout game series. Once I started reading, I couldn't stop.  I'm hoping for a t.v. series on this book sometime!

Good book. It was hard to put down. Kind of eery - especially with so many things going on in the world and country today, and how the government continues to control more and more things in our life. And, with the government doing more things without its citizens' consent, it's not too far of a leap. Definitely an original take on what they are willing to do next!

I am a big fan of sci-fi. When I started this book it seemed like a fallout knock off and the setting seemed limited but as I read I fell in love with howeys writing style and the characters he created. It felt like a punch in the gut every time something happened to a character. I recommend this book to any lover of sci-fi. It is well worth the read.
One of the best books I read this year.  It's a gripping read - perfect summer or travel reading.  Great modern sci fi.  I recommended it to friends after reading about it in slate.

Holy smokes!! I am rarely this entertained by an ebook, much less sci-fi. All I can say is that Hugh Howey made me stay up most of the night reading because there was no alternative. I absolutely MUST know what happens next. Don't even try to wiggle your way out of it, Howey!
Very fun read not exactly sci fi but definitely a unique story.  Kudos to the author for such a well written story
A well written science fiction story , with more real emotions and feelings than others I have read.In addition the author minimized violence.

I was so very surprised to find a book that was unique.  So many topics are unoriginal and have been recycled over and over.  This book brings in a twist that I have never seen before!  It's a definite read.
I have been meaning to read these stories for awhile. And I'm not sure why I waited so long. Pick it up you won't be able to put it down

If you like your fiction speculative, your characters colorful, and your plots twisted, you will love Wool. It has been quite a while since I was so thoroughly engaged in a narrative like this, but Howey is that special blend of story-teller and world-builder that leaves you with a smile on your face and a hunger for more.
A sobering creation of a world with lots of surprises.  Well written, engaging, thought provoking.  Reminds me a bit of Lost.

Wool Omnibus Edition is a quick read with a fascinating story line. Any sci-fi fan familiar with apocolyptic/futuristic storylines will enjoy the story as it unfolds. With multiple well developed characters who take unexpected twists, this story holds your attention throughout. The Omnibus Edition allows you to move quickly though the different books without having to wait for the next edition. After finishing episodes 1-5, I quickly downloaded and read episodes 6-8 plus some interesting fanfiction. Now I'm at a dead stop waiting for Hugh Howey to write the next set of episodes entitled Dust. Hurry up Hugh!!!!!
What I said in title. Great great great wonderful inspiring incredible cant wait for the film. Will there be a film? Oh yeah.
A fabulously creative story of a brave new world after the world as we know it crumbles. In the old tradition of science fiction, and I enjoyed it.

Actually, imho, "great" is inadequate to describe how good this omnibus is. A friend gave it to me for my birthday. I figured it would be a decent read, because she is an ebook editor. But I was hooked by the end of the first page. It is an incredible, yet totally believable story of life in some future where the outside world is deadly and people live in great silos for their entire lives. I was fascinated by the details of HOW they live, which are well and logically presented through the story. No boring expositions here! The book is well written and the plot had me reading late into the night. The characters are so believable I grieved when they suffered. I hope you enjoy this book as much as I did.

After three or four days while reading this, I began to feel claustrophobic. That's how Howey's detailed and realistic portrayal of life in an enormous subterranean silo made me feel. Now on to Shift!

When I began reading Wool Omnibus it felt as though I was transported to a different world entirely.  Almost as if I had been dropped into a Bradbury novel.  At first everything seems ok but the more time you spend in the world the more you start to see the cracks in the society.  Highly enjoyed the characters especially Jahns, Juliette, and Walker.  Wool was hard to put down, and I kept picking up my kindle to finish the story.
I enjoyed this book, good read.  Kept me reading and interested, good development of the characters.  Would read more in the series.
This book kept me turning the pages and wondering what was going to happen next.  The narrators changed/alternated from chapter to chapter which I also enjoyed.

Wonderfully creative. Highly recommended.  Love the SciFi/Love story mix.  Keeps you on your toes.  Every time you think you have it all figured out, some new, delightful twist is added.  You won't want to put it down.
Howey is outstanding, able to craft the inside dialogue of multiple characters as well as the broader story arc. I plan on getting all his books now.

I am a regular and voracious reader who rarely writes reviews. This one deserves positive comment even though I will be one if many voices saying the same thing. I read the 5 books as a long novel so I didn't have to wait for the next installment. I found the story compelling, the characters real, and the logic consistent. This is a believable story that takes place in a future that could actually happen. So as much as it could be called science fiction it really is more likely literary and thriller that happens to be situated in a different time. If you haven't read here books do yourself a favour and pay the $6. Eventually this guys work will cost $14 and it will still be a bargain.
great book easy read. you wouldnt want to put it down. its a real good page turner and i was just in love

This was a post-apocalyptic thriller set in an underground silo. the author describes a bleak world, with class divisions and An ultimate punishment of being a cleaner sent out into a hostile world. Hugh Howey, when is the next edition coming out? I want to know the back story and what happens to Juliette and the survivors.
I read the first book and was hooked. A great story full of interesting people and twists and turns. I highly recommend this series and can't wait for more from the silo residents.

Post apocalyptic fiction is not my thing. It is usually too depressing. But I decided to read this on a friend's recommendation. I am so glad I sucked it up and read it. The pacing was great, the way important plot points spin out almost as an afterthought is great, the characters were multifaceted (even the villains). Great book. Looking forward to what he does next.

It is always fun to enter a newly created world with an opportunity for new adventures and situations. This book provides an abundance of both. The characters were fun and likable or evil as required. Here is a place one would like to be allowed to explore on their own which such a novel allows one to do with secret delight.  Unfortunately, one suspects that this may be as far as the author's imagination may go despite the very fertile ground laid out by the first book -- think "Dune" and "Lord of the Flies".
Way better than I expected. Probably the best book I've read in 5 years. I'll be buying the Shift omnibus next.
Great story, well written and fun to read.  Keep the books coming, I'll be happy to buy them and share with friends.
Recommend to Science fiction and Fantasy readers.  Well written.  Looking forward to the next parts of the Saga.  Should not miss these books considering the price.

This book and series is incredible. Very unique post apocalyptic story line with personable characters and a rich plot. Mr. Howey is pretty much awesome. I will be shocked if this isn't made into a movie and/or television series. I will be doubly shocked if anyone doesn't like the books. Buy, read, say woah that s@*t was crazy. You'll love it.
It has a Slow start, picks up momentum. I am 3/4 into the book and can't put it down. A fascinating theme!

I read Wool after reading a review in the Washington Post.  I'm not really into Sci Fi, but this is more about the main character and her determination to get through the challenges presented.  It was an interesting story but not as well written or as captivating as the Hunger Games series.  Still it wasn't a bad read.
First time i read this author And he is excellent. Book is gripping And full of action. A great read
The story is unque and captivating.  The writing lets you step into the story in terms of understanding the characters and the environment.  I am really loking forward to this ride!

Really there is nothing I can think to add to these reviews. This is an amazing collection and I was only sad when I had finished them all and realized I wanted somehow to have it to do over from the start.
This is a compelling book. I read it fast, all the time wishing it would last a long time, but couldn't make myself go slower.
Great story, griping, and with well written characters. Keeps you wanting to read one more chapter to find out what happens next!
I would not say that this book is as good as some reviews I read but it is worth reading. Its definitely not Hunger Games but somewhat along those lines.
Gave it a chance because of a mention on a blog and I'm really glad I did. Would not at all be surprised to see a great writing career in Hugh's future.
Great look at what makes us tick as a society. Well written, spellbinding. Can hardly wait to hear about other silos.
Hurriedly writing something here so I can go get the rest of the books. Oh and the lady who reads the audio book, well, she isn't the greatest just so you know.
I am ready to move on. Loved the concept and characters. Only slight technical thought: how did they power the sump pump in 17?  "24 volts" and how many amps = too many!
This guy is amazing.  No idea where he came from or how he's publishing material so fast but I hope he doesn't stop anytime soon.

This is a superbly written, excellent series. The story is original and the writing is excellent. I loved this so much that I purchased the "Shift" omnibus (which follows after the "Wool" series). Get these and read them - they are difficult to put down once you start!

For me, the biggest struggle is: can this book grab my attention right away and keep me interested.  I struggle a lot with that.  The only author that has successfully and consistently met that challenge has been Stephen King.  Having said that, this book is perfect.  The pace is just right (although sometimes it feels too heavy with description).  This is solid entertainment and I am happy to have added it to my collection.  Can't wait to read more from this author and this series specifically.
A well-created and believeable creation of a possible future world. Well written and well read! A bargain at the price--

Initially I was perplexed with many questions about the story and had reservations about the direction it was taking.  As the pages turned I found that I was becoming immersed in the novel and finding myself enjoying the adventure.  The author has a way of keeping you guessing about the outcome and taking a direction that will keep you in suspense.

This is a well written post-apocalyptic series of stories. The premise is fascinating and somewhat scary. The characters are well developed to the point that the reader can feel she or he has met them. The unfolding of the story and the gradual revelations are plausible, they hold the reader's interest.

Loved this book as well as the story behind it.  Good character development, fast read, digestable chapters and logical progression once the premis is established.  It's not as heavy and daunting as something like Dune.  It reads like a classic Bradbury or Asimov short story that was lengthened into a novel.
Stumbled upon this author by accident and was happily surprised to discover a talent new to me, well written in a suspenseful way great characters well defined, well worth a read.
I read an article about this series on the bbc website. Now I see what all the fuss is about. Well developed characters that you can't help but get attached to, an engrossing plot, a great
Took a bit to get into this but now I'm in, great human story rather than just sci- fi action/adventure and I'm on to the next in the series

I love, love, love this book! This was the first book that I've read by Howey and it has made me a true fan of his work. The story and world he creates are fascinating, and the characters are vivid. I usually shy away from books that are a saga or part of a series but now I can't wait to read every page of the Silo story. I'll feel like my world will crumble just a little when I read the last chapters from this fictonal world that has invaded my thoughts. This is a must read!
Great series. Well thought out world.  Am reading the rest of the books already.  I am a huge science fiction fan, am totally excited about Hugh Howey.  Can't wait to read more!

Wool is an excellent post-apocalyptic tale. I'm glad I was able to read all of the parts at once, waiting for more would have been excruciating. I found part three to be my least favorite and the first and last books were the best. Wool is definitely a page-turner with lots of suspense, mystery and intrigue. I would definitely recommend!

I am an avid ebook reader.  I find myself downloading new books almost daily.  I found this book while searching for highly reviewed, lower-priced books and gave it a try.  I'm sure glad I did and I'm sure happy to see that there is more available from this author.  I would recommend it to anyone.  While I guess the subject matter would be classified as dystopian fiction, the struggles of the characters come across as very real; without the usual disconnect of time and place that is characteristic in most examples of that type of fiction.
Really fun read, awesome to experience being burned or drowned in a silo - I felt anxious reading every part and couldn't wait to find out how it would turn out and what would be next.  Excellent.

Hugh Howey, is a writer with a true talent for characterization.  You get these people, you root for them and you cry for them. His storyline is focused and the concept keeps your interest. You won't be disappointed with this exciting writer.

Very well written.  Very smart premise and clever ideas.  The author made me like and care about the characters.  Would like to read more in this vein from this author.  I hope he's got more of this in him.
I BURNED through this thing in a week.  The story is really good and I hope they don't kill it in the movie version.  I look forward to the rest of the series.
This was a very good book! I couldn't stop reading the last half of the book! Can't wait to start the next Hugh Howey book

Fabulous writing, gorgeous concept, beautifully executed.  Reminds me of Molly Gloss's "The Dazzle of Day," another fantastic read.  Both books bring you a contained new world: "WOOL" is an underground silo and "Dazzle" a generations-spanning spaceship ... I am in awe of Mr. Howey's writing.  "WOOL" is phenomenal.  Characters are so real, I feel I could reach out and touch them.  Read it.

I thoroughly enjoyed reading this. There are some interesting concepts in it and the way these are revealed kept me hooked. I can't wait to learn more of what will happen to the silos and the world. Thanks for the book. As with all good si fi books there are a lot of lessons to be learned about our future and where we should head.
I was hooked from the first chapter.  As some have said, its not the most original idea, but it is well told.  The story is appealing and engaging.  Good for adolescents as well as adults.

This is my new all time favorite book.  Hugh Howey is an amazing author that bought his story of a dystopian post apocalyptic world where people live in a silo to life.  His descriptions played out like movie in my head and the story remained quick paced.  I have already started the second series and am looking forward to him publishing the third.  I think of a fan for life.  I would recommend this book to anyone young adult and up.  There is some foul language and some violence.

Loved this book. Not usually a genra I like, but this book combines mystery, adventure, compassion, and courage into a fantastic futuristic tale.  Great story!  I had a difficult time putting it down and can't wait to get my hands on the next one.  Please Hugh Howey, don't make me wait to long.
This really had me involved in rooting for the main characters. Good job Mr. Howey, and thanks. I hope you continue with the story.
It's pretty rare that a book kept my attention the way wool did. Great story, great characters I can't wait to start eating the "Shift" collection.

This is a far, far better than most of the drivel that gets foisted on the public by established authors working for the big name publishers. I hope to read a great many more Hugh Howey stories in the future!

My aunt suggested I read this series several months ago, and I put it off. Big mistake. This series is amazing. The characters are well developed, and the plot is so enticing. I definitely missed a few deadlines because I was so busy reading. I highly recommend this series!
Follows several characters through parts of there lives which slowly explains the world they are living in. Can be a bit depressing at times but a very good read.
Exciting, fast-paced, and fun. Can't wait to read the next one. Would recommend to anyone who enjoys science fiction books.
This was a compelling story that did not follow the usual sci-fi formula.  The author did a good job of fleshing out the characters so that you actually cared what happened to them.

I have to admit, I wasn't so sure about this book to begin with, even with many people I know saying how much they enjoyed this.  But, about 10 pages in, I was absolutely hooked...science fiction has never been quite as addictive and hard to put down as this one.  My review is short, since the book speaks for itself.  Well, well done book.

Wool is sure to be a sci-fi classic. I was hooked from the beginning and continually kept guessing by a number of amazing plot twists. As well, the characters are engaging, relatable, and well-developed. I strongly recommend this book for anyone who likes science fiction, dystopia novels, post-apocalyptic works, or thrillers. Well done!
When it is easy to picture what the writer is saying and  thinking about it days after it's finished tends to mean that it was an excellent read.
It has been a long time since I have picked up a book that I didn't want to put down.  I was almost sad at the end. So much more to tell!  Can't wait to start Shift.

This author deserves every penny he has earned from his self-publication of this book.  One of the best books I have read this year.  I've already read Shift Omnibus Edition, and am looking forward to the rest of this series.  Highly recommended.

The Wool Omnibus Edition was gripping from the very start.  Futuristic sci fi is not my normal genre but after the review in The Herald Tribune, it was a must try.  Well,it has been a very long time since I couldn't put down a book.  Hue Howey is a master.  The characters come to life in a world so different and unknown to us.  The plot grabs you and keeps the pages turning to discover what happens.  Please continue this series, we want to hear more about life in the Silos.  Thanks for a most wonderful read !!!!!

This book deserves a five, but I gave it a 4 only because I ended up skipping paragraphs because the author would describe things to such great lengths. It slowed down the story's momentum. Great story nonetheless.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book and couldn't put it down. I found that it wasn't overly technical, a refreshing change from most sci-fi. The reader is able to visualize the action, the setting, and the characters throughout the entire story which will probably help this book remain accessible to a wide audience, not just sci-fi lovers. There is some very imaginative storytelling going on here, mixed with plenty of page-turning thrills.

I haven't been able to put this series down. I'm not much of a reader but I've absolutely fallen in love with this series. The writing is fantastic and, just when you think you can guess what will happen next, the author turns the story upside-down!

What a fantastic series! I stumbled upon these books looking for some good post apocalyptic science fiction and sure found it. I'm a little nervous that I'll never find anything quite like t,his again but at the same time so gratified that I did find it. Kinda coming off a Wool readathon high here! Hugh Howey you sir are the man!  Thanks for the read and I look forward too checking out your other works.
Not generally a sci-fi fan. This had human interaction and character development. Will read the next installment to follow the Silo inhabitants
I really enjoyed this book.  The characters were engaging and the silo concept was unique.  I highly recommend the book.

This book is extremely well constructed. The main characters are easy to like or dislike as the case may be. Hugh Howey has a great knack for developing suspense and keeping you there. Looking forward to the next 3 books. As soon as I finish this review, I'm buying them.
Just wow...i was really thrown for a loop with this book. So much to like but so little i can say without spoiling it. Totally lives up to the hype.

My most interesting read of the year.  I'm always fascinated by books that craft a post apocalyptic survival story (The Passage, World War Z, The Road) - and this one is SO interesting.  Nothing supernatural, just human interaction in a survival silo after what appears to be some sort of nuclear war.  I couldn't read this book fast enough and quickly picked up the sequel (Shift) after I finished.  I also love the author's view of things.  Super humble  and appreciative of his success in the Q & A in the back - when asked why his books are so cheap (he actually gave the individual Wool stories away to start) he said it was because he was a nobody.  Can't wait to see what Ridley Scott does with the movie treatment of this book!
Recommended reading for anyone who owns a bug-out bag. Shows what the Man is capable of when authority isn't questioned.

Great story...well written...bummed that there wasn't more to keep reading. Wool is areal 'flashlight under the covers' book that you just want to read in one go...awesome new world to explore. Details did not intrude, but built the silo in mind.

I wish that I had known how gripping this story would be, for I would have began reading it when I had the time to do so!  I couldn't put it down - I read until my eyes shut on their own.  Great story, excellent characters, and emotions you can feel.

Very unusual take on the apocalypse theme. I thought Juliette was one tough cookie!  I thought it was very interesting how people could live in this huge silo all together, but sometimes didn't see each other for months or even years.

After seeing this book continue to rack up amazing reviews, and seeing the relatively low cost, I took a chance and picked it up for my Fire.  Within the first few pages I was hooked and powered through the entire collection in the next two days.  Mr. Howey made such an impression on me that I bought the "Shift Omnibus" the day I finished this one and read it in a couple of sittings.  He does an excellent job with creating intense situations, character building, and weaving an intricate storyline.  I'm definitely looking forward to more entries in this series!

On par with Foundation and filled with the passion and depth of character of Hunger Games.  Satisfying, well written, well edited, and overall a "must read" for all fans of the dystopia and post-apocalypse genre.

Very good read with just the right level of suspense!  The chapters were the perfect size to keep me saying "Just one more chapter...".  The only negative was the lack of sleep I got until I finished!!  Great job Hugh!!  I'm Shift now, and it is great as well!
This book series blew my mind. I can't wait for the (hopefully not seriously) last installment. Currently can't get enough of this author.
Not only a story of a possible bleak future for mankind but a ray of hope.  We may make a mess of it, but the seed of humanity may still prevail.

I liked this story and the writing improved as the story unfolded. I could see some crazy scheme like this being put into place. And of course the "everyone is equal" will never work, people aren't made like that. What happened to the other silos? Why were all the people going outside? Why did we poison the air? Yes, I would like to read more.
A fantastic story full of twists and turns. The characters are well developed and manage to draw you in quite easily. You will not regret buying this book. I hope the author keeps the story going!
This is a wonderfully crafted story.  A complex world with many characters and a shifting reality.  Really makes you think about how we order our world.
Wool 1 - 5 is a well written, gripping drama.  It was fun to read, but also asked important questions about our society today and what we want our future to be.

This is considered sci-fi but I liked this book a lot because it could really happen!  After a catastrophic event a small group of people are living in self-sufficient underground silos.  It is a behind the scenes look at what it takes to keep the peace and continue to live as civilized people.  I'm interested to read more to see where the next book takes the story.  But this is a very entertaining book and makes you realize how easy it would be for this to come true.
Mr. Howey oves me a lot of missed sleep. Every time I buy one of his books, I end up not able to put it down.
Excellent, very unique. Reminded me somewhat of The Hunger Games by Suzanne Collins in concept. Fast moving plot, with lots of action and suspence.

When the first book came out , I looked at the reviews and saw it was well received but for some reason I passed on buying it. I think it was the title. Boy did I make a mistake. After seeing that the there was an edition consisting of 5 volumes I decided to buy. This book is not only a good read but it kind of makes you wonder if something like what's described could ever happen. Probably not but still........ You can't help but cheer on the spirit and fortitude of the people that try to advance humanity from the grips of confinement and despair. Read the book and then read the following series in the Silo Saga," Shift"
So many twists and turns in this series. Not your typical sci fi/fantasy, but a more realistic story of what could happen to this world because of human nature. So hard to wait for the final book!

Hugh. Howet demonstrates the unique ability to compell the reader to voraciously consume the pages in order to see where this story goes, if there is hope, and if this unlikely heroic character - like  the heroine in the Hunger Games trilogy - will survive. While the setting of "Wool" isn't pleasant, it's the image we can foresee of the not-too-distant future and it should give the reader pause for this result. The book grabs you from the first page.

Whilst browsing the Kindle section of Amazon for something different in the sci-fi genre I came across Wool.  Not only was the price appealing but the reviews were great so I decided to give it a go.  I did notice that one reviewer actually had the balls to compare Wool to Hyperion which was what really sparked my interest.  Having read Wool, I now get that comparison.  Wool is brilliantly crafted and the characters are very well developed.  I'll keep this review short and sweet by saying that this stuff is absolutely amazing and you'll be dying to know what's going to happen next with each digital turn of the page.  As far as apocalyptic survival stories go, Wool ranks up there with the best of the best.  MORE PLEASE GOOD SIR!
The concept is original, the characters unique. There is mystery enough to keep you reading. Just when I think I have something figured out, there is a twist.  Good job Hugh Howey.
The first chapter had me scared and I had to put this series down for a few weeks.  I finally got back to it and I am so glad I did.  I did not put it down until the end and still want more.

I don't think I've ever seen anything with this many 5-star ratings on Amazon, and now I can say definitively that they are well deserved. I bought the Omnibus edition on reviews alone, having no idea what I was getting myself into. I finished all 500+ pages in less than a day, not because it was a overly easy read, but because it was devilishly difficult to put down! I would recommend this to any adult, male or female, regardless of the genre they typically enjoy.
I couldn't put this down. From the very first pages I was hooked with the characters. I can't wait to read what happens next.
Top notch sci fi, you can't tell what will happen next.  Looking forward to reading more of Howey's books.  Good price also.
This is a wonderful story! I couldn't put down the book. I have to give it two thumbs up way up! I felt like I was there in the silo living on the razors edge!! A really good read!!

This is the first review I have ever been compelled to write. Wool captivated me from the beginning and is unlike anything I have ever read. Truly well deserving of the 5 star rating! I am among the thousands of hardcore fans anxiously awaiting more! I have recently purchased copies for friends because I am so insistent they read it!
With so many positive reviews I had to read this series and I was in no way disappointed.  I'm looking forward to more novels from this writer!
Such a great tale, or set of tales, of a beautiful place. Somewhere that should be dark and dreary and hopeless but somehow isn't. Highly recommended.
Best I have read in a long time.  I couldn't put it down. Told so many about this book and it interesting theme.
Great piece of work that was surprising and symbolic on many literary levels.  Plus was just a good fun read.
I love a book that is well written! A wonderful story that kept me turning the pages, and wishing it would last a little longer.

I'm a little bit in love with Hugh Howey's characters and his writing. I'm a big fan of dystopian novels and this is my new favorite. It is a tightly crafted novel with rich characters, themes and plots. The characters are haunting me but I especially love how he uses them to explore the themes of community, group psychology, free will, love and power. I also appreciate that the sci-fi element is finely balanced as a support to the main themes and characters. This book is easy to recommend to all kinds of readers because the characters and story are so compelling. I think you will be glad you gave it a try.
It 's a great story with many characters with whom you instantly become attached. Don't. Just kidding. Destined to be a classic.
I could not put this book down. Well crafted and thought out. If you are looking for something new get this.
I normally pick the most uninteresting books. I chose this book based on the reviews I read on Amazon. WOW! I can't put it down. Be prepared to be swallowed into the world of the Silo!
Author gets right to the meat,no repetitive catch phrases,pits the reader in at the first chapter,very fun mystery,well thought out
I enjoy Sci Fi and was the best one I've read in a while.  The quality + the price make this series difficult to beat.

I found this book and decided to read it due it's high ratings and wasn't disappointed. It's an easy and captivating read. The author keeps you guessing at every turn. It was suspenseful and highly addictive. The ending was good and you certainly can't beat the price! I would've paid more to read such a good book. I would love to see this made into a movie!
Great story and very well written. I had to dole it out so I wouldn't finish it too quickly. Highly recommended! Can't wait to see if there will be more....

I have never considered myself a fan of sci-fi.  I've always said I'd rather chew off my arm than sit and watch an episode of Star Trek, Star Wars, etc, etc.  My 80-year old neighbor recommended this series to me and she was right; I could not put it down.  The plot development is excellent.  Characters are so real that you feel like you are there with them.  I blazed through all five books of Wool and am now on the final book of Shift and find myself trying to pace myself, just to make it last longer so I won't have to wait so long for the next one.  The story line is one that keeps turning, keeping you guessing, thinking and yes, dreaming about it at night.  I'm not sure I'll become a sci-fi junkie, but for sure have become a Hugh Howey junkie!!!  Well done!
I am still reading this, am about halfway & loving it! No idea how this is going to turn out!
Author Howey did a great job. The story moves along and except for a couple times, needing to really suspend disbelief, it was engaging. The central idea  around the Silos is all too possible.

Mr. Howey's skill as a writer combines with his story-telling gifts to deliver a terrific tale of a terrifying future!  You will smell the grease from the 'down deep', feel the grit hit your helmet and shiver in the chilly waters at the bottom of the silo as you explore Mr. Howey's fascinating and fantastic world.  A 'must' for science fiction fans; an 'ought to' for anyone who values good writing, strong characters and a great tale!
This dystopian novel is gripping and would make an outstanding movie.  The reader is pulled into this world he creates with vivid characters and action.

My mother is a voracious reader. She reads 1-2 books a day. She always tells me you should read this, you should read that. When she read Wool, she said I had no choice. We have to discuss this book together. So I purchased the omnibus and it was SO WORTH it. I have told all my friends and now they are reading it and love it too. Thanks Hugh Howey! Can't wait for more.
This was a very well written book and keeps the reader wanting to finish all of the stories at once.  I stayed up several nights very late, it was that good!  Would make a good movie
I couldn't stop reading this series. Plot twists, endearing characters, nail-biting scenes. I am looking forward to reading more by Howey!
I liked the story but yet it felt like something was missing.  It was enjoyable but it was not a 5.

I loved the series, and immediately bought the Shift Omnibus once I was finished with it. It's one of those books that you totally get immersed in; the Silo world is intense and addicting, and it's impossible not to read "just ONE more chapter."  Very well written, so interesting and entertaining, and you can't really ask for more than that! :)

Wool is a well written sci-fi with interesting characters surviving in a post-apocalyptic world.  It was perfectly paced, never boring. I'm really looking forward to reading the next book  'The Shift Omnibus'.

I started reading book 1 since it was free and it was recommended by a friend.  I instantly felt connected to the characters and found myself thinking about this book during any downtime during the day and dreaming about it at night.  The plot is well planned and leaves you always craving just a bit more.  Time to buy the Shift edition!
A fun read with lots of drama and a good story that will continue. I crosses age lines so many in the family can enjoy it.
